definition: the traces of a person's movements/(fig.) sb's history/the ins and out of a matter
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
footprint/trace/tracks

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
variant of 跡|迹[ji4]
footprint/mark/trace/vestige/sign/indication/Taiwan pr. [ji1]
variant of 跡|迹[ji4]

sentences.english: He paid little attention to their comings and goings .
sentences.chinese: 他对他们的来踪去迹很少注意。

definition: lit. the goose comes, the swallow goes (idiom); fig. always on the move
to see the light again (idiom); delivered from oppression
see 百思不解[bai3 si1 bu4 jie3]
entirely/without exception/(literary) to be together/to be alike
bird in a basket, monkey in a cage (idiom); prisoner
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
lit. almanac from years back (idiom)/obsolete practice/old-fashioned principle
as if degenerating into smoke (idiom); ignorant and unable to see where things are heading
to enumerate what is black and yellow (idiom); to criticize sb behind his back to incite quarrels/also written 數黑論黃|数黑论黄[shu3 hei1 lun4 huang2]
to reply (to a letter)
that being the case/then/in that case
at a loss/confused/not know what to do next
none doesn't/there is none who isn't/everyone
(of literature, music) deeply moving (idiom)
sacrificing one's life generously (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause
too frightened to move or speak
